intro: Echium biebersteinii, commonly known as the Sierra Madre penstemon, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are tubular and attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Echium biebersteinii is valued in native plant gardens for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
